The Meatballs were small and ridiculously overpriced for only getting three tiny ones and a few tiny plain crostini pieces that desperately needed a drizzle of olive oil.  Tiny portions at high prices were also seen with the admittedly yummy garlic cheese bread that was basically four half slices of an Italian loaf.  It did have a lot of cheese on it, and was great when dipped in marinara.

Refills were provided when needed.  My mint chip shake was garnished with mint chocolate cookies (looked like thin mints) and was very tasty.

Service was pretty shaky.  The server forgot my shake, and then my shake did not arrive in its to-go container.  I also had to ask for our box of leftovers, which was apparently sitting in their kitchen.  The manager did bring them out and apologized.

I probably won't be back.

Okay pizza, rude service. The cashier gave me the impression that she could care less whether I ate there or not. Did not greet me when I approached the register, and rather than thanking me for coming, after I paid, she immediately turned her back. I was the only customer. Would have been almost understandable had there actually been a line. No one else was there. If they change the staff up, I'd probably give a 4 star rating.

Excellent thin crust pizzas with great toppings and an ok selection of local craft beers. Take away a giant slice for $5!

Absolutely the most affordable dining option at aria. And the monopoly machines are right outside too!

For what it is, it gets 5 stars.  It is a pizza place, but it has a full bar, great tasty food and enough variety.  We have eaten here several times and I am about to go back tonight.  If you are visiting, this is much more than safe bet.  

Hint:  The big line mid day is for pizza by the slice.  Walk around the line to get to the bar where you can sit down and have a drink and and some great food.

If you are looking for the best pizza on the Vegas strip, look no further than the Five50 Pizza Bar in Aria. It's located near the sports book not far from the poker room. The place is named for the temperature the chef believes is perfect for pizza. These are big New York-style slices of pizza with ample toppings, plenty of cheese and a zesty sauce in just the right amount. If you're looking for a quick lunch, you can order by the slice right at the counter and have your food in just minutes. Like I said, it's the best pizza I've had in Vegas and I doubt you'll be disappointed.

Love love love the pizza here! Perfectly cooked and amazing toppings! My favorite is the forager and truffle! Can't go wrong with either one.  John V. Is always so nice and helpful! We tried the garlic bites and mushroom aracini. Garlic bites are not the usual but have a great flavor and crispy yet soft. The service is amazing and always a fun yet sophisticated vibe. Great place in aria!
Great pizza, delicious sandwiches, lovely decor, fast service, and the prices aren't outrageous for Vegas.

I have dined here twice and enjoyed it both times.

The first time, we sat at the bar before seeing Zarkana. It was a busy night and the service was a bit slow, but friendly. Not a big deal - we planned quite enough time before the show and weren't in a rush.

We shared everything:

Garlic Knots ($6): Great portion and huge knots. Really tasty.

Beer Mac 'n Cheese ($12 - half order): Again, good portion size and really good - the prosciutto is a nice touch.

Chef's Selection Charcuterie (6 for $28): I know it seems pricey, but man was it worth it! They were not stingy with the meat/cheese and we actually got to choose the 6 we wanted. We went with both Burrata and Buffalo Mozzarella, as well as the Humbodlt Fog. For meats we had Mortadella, Soppressata and Prosciutto. Everything was really fresh and SO SO good. i would definitely order this again and it was perfect for sharing.

Finally we got the Gotham pizza ($28): Also pricey, but we both really enjoyed it. It had pepperoni, salami and sausage. 

We ended up with way too much food and were stuffed. They also have good drink specials - I thought the prices for the beer/shot combos were really good and they have a great selection of beers.

The 2nd time I dined there, I just grabbed a quick slice from the slice counter. The great thing is that the counter is open until 3 AM on Fri/Sat. It was just $5.95 for a HUGE slice of pizza and it was really good. This time I got the "Forager," which has whitesauce, mushrooms, bacon, whipped ricotta and spinach. I've been dreaming about this slice ever since.

Overall, it fits a certain "niche," it's connected to the Race & Sports Book and can be considered a fast casual experience. Or you can grab a slice on your way back to your room - both are great options. I'll definitely be back soon!

This place has really awesome pizza. We had the Chopped Salad and the Gotham Pizza and both were amazing. 

The staff are super friendly and just the right amount of attentive. 

I'd recommend this place to anyone.

My girlfriend and I decided to try this place on a whim because we were feeling a pizza, didn't really want to do some hole-in-the-wall pizza joint, and I was up a little bit on blackjack winnings. We chose to go to Five50 because of positive reviews on OpenTable, good pictures of the pizza, and the fact that it was at the Aria which has a lot of prestige under its belt for its age.

We were quite impressed with the pizza and the service here. It's just swanky enough to feel like you're getting your money's worth but not so much that you forget that it's still a sports bar with a casual ambiance. They serve Fiji water, which was nice, albeit expensive. All-in-all, with two bottles of Fiji and our pizza, we spent about $45. Not terrible for Vegas, especially being in the Aria.

We've both decided this ranks as probably the 2nd or 3rd best pizza we've had in our lives, so, that says something!

I liked Five50 Pizza Bar. So much, in fact, that I ended up coming twice in the course of one night at the Aria. It was an easy, comfortable spot for dinner as well as for drinks and dessert after some time on the casino floor. The only problem with Five50 Pizza Bar was that the pizza was no good.

We came for an early Sunday dinner after driving in from LA with no particular plans. We were thinking about leaving the Aria, which is where we were staying, but inertia got the best of us when we stumbled across a pizza place right by the sports betting station. It was only 5:30, but we were hungry after our time on the road, and the restaurant was beautifully empty.

I liked the vibe of the place. Very much of one piece with the Aria, ritzy and modern with high ceilings and interesting decor, but casual and fuss-free. There was a large bar that ended up being half the point of the place, and service was solid. We ended up coming back with a couple more friends when we needed a place to catch up later in the night. We brought our leftover pizza for them to eat, and our server didn't call us out for having the take-out box on the table.

That pizza, though, was some of the worst I've had in a while--no contest when measured against others in its price range. These were expensive personal pies, and they just didn't taste good. They were flawed on a basic level, limp and greasy with way too much cheese. The toppings were good, at least. The Catania came with white sauce, garlic purée, Italian sausage, rapini, and roasted tomato; the Forager with white sauce, mushrooms, bacon, whipped ricotta, and spinach. Pretty good ideas, but not enough to redeem the pizzas.

Weirdly, everything else was great. The beet salad was excellent, a colorful mix of local beets with watercress, farro, pumpkinseed vinaigrette, and grissini. One of my friends doesn't like burrata, so we got it with goat cheese--accommodating kitchen, and a nice substitution. When we came back after dinner, I had some kind of craft beer on tap (I forget which, but it was a good one), and partook in a couple of decadent milkshakes. The Vegas root beer float was a satisfying shake loaded with vanilla ice cream, caramel, Butterfinger crumbles, and Boylan's root beer. The mint chocolate swirl mixed mint ice cream with chocolate syrup and chocolate mint cookies--what's not to like there? All shakes were available in adult iterations, but the beer was good enough for me.

I enjoyed Five50 Pizza Bar despite its failure to deliver good pizza. I'd recommend it for an easy drink or meal if you're hanging out at the Aria. I wouldn't hesitate to go back; I just might avoid the signature offerings.

Located inside the Aria casino. I love that the place is open late. We were debating whether to sit down and order a whole pizza or to just grab a quick slice from the counter. We opted for just a slice each from the counter (options there are more limited than if you were to sit down and order a whole pie). The pizza smelled delicious and I was hungrily waiting for it to come out of the reheating oven.  I ordered the Gotham which consist of mozzarella cheese, grana padano and meats (sausage, salami and of course, pepperoni). The slice is pretty decent sized and thin in height but there was more than enough toppings for it. Unfortunately, it was sooo oily, too oily. I folded my slice to take a bite and quickly, drops of meat oil dripped down. I get it, it's the toppings fault for all that oiliness but that didn't make me want to get another one of those slices. I would maybe go back but for a different kind of slice.. like the truffle potato one or the forager. Fast, easy and affordable late night pizza is always a o k in my book.

Certainly cannot agree with the 4+5 star reviews ot this place, since it may be the most expensive pizza restaurant in Las Vegas. We ordered the Gotham Pizza, which is "supposed" to include pepperone, sausage & salami, but there was ZERO salami, & only a smattering of sausage. Perhaps a dozen circles of pepperoni. Lots of cheese if that pleases you? For $28 I think customers should expect something "better". Onions? Peppers? Olives? Mushrooms?  However, anything above the minimal serving of meat, would push the price well above $30, since each ingredient adds another $2. For those who want to spend $30-40++ on a 16" pizza, I wish them well. For us -- we go to Wolfgang Puck's in the Crystal Shopping Mall attached to ARIA, & get a better pizza for 1/2 the price.

Terrible service on Christmas Eve! Waitress doesn't want to be here and she made that very clear. Asked her how her night was..... "It's Christmas Eve I would rather be with my kids." Wow not really sure where to go from there way to make it awkward. Food great. Atmosphere usually great. But really if you are trying to pull at heart string for a bigger tip by telling me how much you hate being at work no go kitten sorry.

Five50.  Love the name.  I failed to ask the origin of it.  My guess would be the oven temp? Who knows...and nevertheless the pizzas are very good.   They char them just enough in the ovens to give it a little flavor and character.  Toppings aren't skimpy and the salads and soups are good complimentary parts of the meal.  Solid craft beer line-ups on draft including local craft breweries and some out of state.  Their bottle craft beers are solid as well. 
Nice ambiance, well lit, and upbeat.  Service during the day was a little slow but I can look the other way one since the meal was good.

The pizza was good, but then again it's kinda hard to mess up. If you are looking for a quick fix and you're in City Center then I'd recommend it. I wouldn't say it is worth going out of your way to try.

We stayed at the Aria specifically because five50 pizza is there. I first tried it back in April, and when we planned this trip, I knew we had to be as close to this pizza as possible. Yes, I really really love pizza. Needless to say, we got pizza to-go up to our room both nights after gambling. If we hadn't made a few other meal plans for our 2 day trip, I would have eaten in the restaurant because their garlic knots are the best I've ever had! I don't think I'll ever be able to visit Vegas again without having at least a slice of five50 pizza!

Pizza was so-so, server and service was horrible and server was incompetent. Thursday is industry night and I am in the industry so I should have received 50% off, waiter refused to give me the discount and then proceeded to tell me that it was only for MGM employees. Then took the cash of the table as his tip when he was to apply the cash and then run the card for the balance. HORRIBLE experience.
My wife and I stopped here for a quick dinner. We ordered The Gotham, which was a very good pizza!  The service was very good too. We'll stop here again!
Awesome place, great food and atmosphere. Our waiter was friendly and prompt. Chef Shawn is a great guy and I highly recommend this restaurant.

I was at Five50 last week and there was a friendly little green worm crawling across my friend's salad plate....when the attractive Latina manager finally arrived at our table she mumbled something about organic and deal with it....but not in that order....for an incredibly humble white boy like myself that answer would be more than acceptable...my friend is an attractive African American woman- who is not only a well paid executive in LA- but has not yet gotten to the point where the green worm thing is part of her cultural cuisine ...I don't think their exchange did anything to improve interracial relations....if only the environ of thirty dollar pizza's could be a little more post racial think how great the world would be....( in truth the whole incident might not have happened if it hadn't taken 45 minutes to get us two pizza's in a half full restaurant....the little green fellow might have just crawled away....)...

Hey Shawn your servers at Sage are a tad smarmy as well...I know you are from Chicago but you and your team need to tone it down a notch or two...

I really enjoyed this place on my recent visit to the Aria Casino. It's located near the sports book, which was a plus for me.  The pizza was great and they had a nice selection of local craft beer, which was nice since I was visiting from out of town.

5 Stars all the way!

not a hype!!! Was recommended to this place and I was not let down! This place is fun! Pizza is delicious! I wish I could have taken more pizza home! I'm a pizza lover and my oh my! Exceeded my expectations! Price is def worth it! It's a must go place!

Items Selected:

Pepperoni Arancini- Rice Balls, Red Sauce and Roasted Garlic Aioli

Pigs and Truffles- Pork Shoulder Cannelloni, Bordeaux Spinach, Bechamel and Summer Truffles

North Beach- Clams, Smoked Mozzarella, Sweet Onions, Oregano

Blanca- Mozzarella, Ricotta, Bel Paese, White Chedder, Olive Oil, Garlic, Basil 

Truffle- Truffle Salami, Bechamel, Parmesan, Thyme, Shaved Truffles

Margherita- Tomato, Buffalo Mozzarella and Basil

Warm Apple Pie - White Cheddar, Oatmeal Streusel, Smoke Salted Mascarpone Ice Cream

Crispy Sourdough Fritters - Winter Spiced Cranberry Sauce, Orange Glaze

A fan of Shawn McClain dating to his Chicago days and a truly impressive experience at Sage it was with high hopes that our party of four paid a visit to upscale pizza parlor Five50 after the disaster that was Yellowtail and while I personally enjoyed the experience more than my companions it would be exceedingly difficult for me to recommend a $30/pp pizzeria with awkward service as a place to visit in a city where far better pie can be found off-strip at a fraction of the price.  Featuring a slice counter plus a handful of primi, pasta, salads, and desserts alongside 16" pizzas cooked in a 550 degree oven the "style" of McClain's signature pies falls somewhere between traditional New York slices and a Roman lightly-leavened 'crunchy' crust but with ingredient quality meeting the standards set by Sage the results were largely impressive save for the excessive use of oil and salt marring the Truffle and an unannounced red sauce lending a peculiar barbecue note to the North Beach.  Faring better, a simple Margherita assuredly displayed the restaurant's sourcing with tangy tomatoes and fresh basil while the Blanca shined largely to a thick dollop of house-made ricotta on each slice.  Moving past pizza, a sampling of the cannelloni proved to be my favorite savory of the day, albeit slightly overpriced at $18 for two pasta tubes stuffed with tender pork and topped with creamy Bechamel plus meager truffle shavings while a trio of arancini presented a unique riff on a classic by substituting house cured pepperoni for traditional sausage and pairing it with thick, aromatic aioli.  Never happy to leave a restaurant without dessert, a final pairing arrived at the table in the form of a small apple pie with accoutrements both sweet and savory alongside fried brioche cubes paired with sour cranberry sauce; both sweets trumping any of the savories and a saving grace at the end of a meal that fell short of high expectations.

I've had lunch here a number of times and dinner twice. All times were above adequate.  
Sadly the parking on a Tuesday afternoon was rather challenging. It took me twenty minutes at the machine. Three cars ahead of me. I should've known, piling on took ten minutes. Luckily the attendant was on hand and she was helpful. Bonus, she remembered assisting me when I came in. The bar wouldn't go up and she even had issues with it releasing up so I could proceed into the garage. Yes, my plate was correctly on the parking meter ticket. Leaving it told me invalid ticket. That was after waiting twenty minutes on the line so I could leave. 
Now, onto lunch (once I finally left the parking garage situation).
Met some friends yesterday afternoon who were staying at Aria. It was about 12:30 on a Tuesday- not at all busy. Our waitress was far from that. My friend's husband inquired about the soup, and she spoke AT him and then as if he had no idea about soup or food. If personalities were sold, I would purchase one for her. She never returned inquiring if we needed anything additional. When she brought our drinks she basically threw them down. We thought about dessert, espresso what have you. Then we thought about our waitress. Thought it was better in just leaving sooner than later. The pizza wasn't fully cooked, underneath was more on the raw dough end and no brown on the bottom.  It had a nice taste, mushrooms and sausage. Who can honestly not have made a pizza correctly. They did- not cooking it fully.

This is for the pizza to go portion of the restaurant.

The pizzas are supposed to be a quick gourmet pizza, so don't expect to find your typical toppings aside from just pepperoni. There were maybe 4-5 options. The pizzas themselves were just meh. The crust was not that thin and crunchy. For a better late night pizza, secret pizza at the Cosmo is a much better option. Also, the line moves sooo slow.

Five50 Pizza Bar is located in the Aria. The décor is unremarkable though there was a great selection beers.

I ordered a margarita pizza - this is a basic pizza when done correctly can be utterly amazing. It is usually a fresh tomato sauce, basil and mozzarella cheese. This pizza was really disappointing. 

$30 for a 16" pizza that was literally dripping in grease. We had to use 4 napkins just to soak it up, it was served luke warm, had to be warmed up, which resulted in more grease. The crust was odd - it had a sour dough taste.

Not great, not bad. Pretty expensive for pizza, but then again it is a pizza spot in a major casino on the Las Vegas Strip. The pizza it's self is pretty good, a little less grease would be nice though.

Have been here a few times now and I have to say that it could be one of my favorite pizzas in town now.  It is thin crust pizza with just the right crisp on the crust.  
We have tried the Gotham (pepperoni, sausage and salami), the Farmstead (Prosciutto, an Egg and Olives) and the Forager Pizza (Mushrooms, Spinach and Rosemary) as well as the Arancini, their AH.MAZ.ING Garlic Bread and a couple salads.  I seem to always go back to the Gotham Pizza....it is by far, my favorite.  They have a decent wine and beer menu and they also have a full bar too.  ANd if you are only in the mood for a slice to go,  they have a to go bar at the front for that.  The service has always been good and the decor is nice too.
It is almost impossible to find pizza as good as this unless you are on NYC it Italy.  Excellent!

We stayed at the Aria recently with some friends and made two stops to five 50. They have a great selection of beers on tap (if you're in the mood for a boozy lunch) and plenty of options with pizzas, charcuterie, sandwiches, and salads. If you are into cheeses - something from the mozzarella bar should do the trick. The pizzas and were delicious and the crust was top notch. The take away bar is great for a late night slice, don't look past the Forager. Great place!

Food was excellent. Service at the table was excellent. Pizza is so flavorful, we had the Margherita pizza and chopped salad. Loved them both. I heard about this place and we decided to walk over and try it.  I am very happy I did - this pizza makes others seem just average. Highly recommend!  Also the bar area had a nice atmosphere, very comfortable place.

Pizza tastes great. Everything else is not good.  The salad is 14.00 for a portion size that's worth 1.50 side salad. The service lacks any enthusiasm or charisma. A soda is 4.50. I know we are on vacation and can pay a little more for food but thee prices are way out of line for the portions.

OK
You will pay about $30 for a pizza. Kind of crazy, but you are in a casino-hotel. It is very good. We split one with half classic cheese and tomato and half with truffles. This is a good pie. I enjoyed it, and I am a pizza snob.
The small plates for starters are good. They are just REALLY small for the three people.
Good place. Nice service. No complaints!

Used up part of our daily resort credit one night here and went with the regular cheese pizza.  Very Large, almost too much... see, the pizza is very thin, which I don't mind, the sauce had a nice tang to it, which is much appreciated and the cheese was pretty good, but the weight of the cheese and sauce weighted down the pizza triangle about 2/3 of the way...to my liking, the crust should be able to stand up to the toppings... the crust however, had  a very nice crunch, and I usually don't eat the crust, but I made an exception on this one. 
Service here is very strange, borderline bad, with pretty snobby staff. I inquired if our to-go pizza was ready to which they implied "4 more minutes"... so we waited by the little tables right there in plain view... few minutes go by, I see a pizza sitting there and ask if that was mine... "oh, yes" they say.  Wait, I said, you don't call them.... to which I quote "no, not really.... sometimes the girls will" .... so you know I'm right here... and you leave my pizza to get cold here on the counter?? ugh .. enough said.

Great quality, fast service! Just the right amount of everything. I had the picante pizza. Not as spicy as advertised (I'm from So Cal so even fiery hot is bland).  Nice decor and stylish music. I highly recommend this place.

The blanca pizza that my husband and I shared for an early dinner before catching the Cirque du Soleil MJ One show, was amazing! This place even carried my favorite beer in the whole wide world, Fruli! I gave this place four stars instead of five because our waitress seemed moody. But either way, I would definitely go back. :)

Soooooooo good!!!! Soon delicious... do I need to say more? wait yes, friendly staff! It was the last night of a trade show and I was starving and exhausted but very happy to know that this place was still open by the time I got back to the SLS because it was so good just thinking about it waters my mouth!

Best of the newest restaurants in Vegas. Server had spunk. Pizza with egg on top would be tops on my list. Starter of Parmesan bread would be wonderful if all you had with a beer of course. Found doing search on net for new places. Would require coming back again.  Great lunch spot.

My favorite pizza spot in Vegas yet!  The pizza was hot and delicious, they had an awesome beer selection and a great ambiance.  Great for a sit down meal and even better for a between gambling snack or post-dancing grub.  Good pricing too (especially in Vegas).  

My suggestion to the owner is to stay open later on the weekdays, even if it's just the carry out!  

Overall, solid slice!

Tried the Pizza by the slice counter on our first night here at resort, best pizza I've had in a very long time and I'm from Chicago, so believe me, I know my pizza! Decided to try the actual restaurant for dinner tonight. Ordered Cesar salad for dinner, not very tastey, not enough dressing in salad, but croutons were delicious. Overall, I would recommend that everyone gives these guys a try.

Awesome pies... take out counter... by the slice...

Didn't eat in the dining room, but the slices from the take-out counter were phenomenal.  

Dat forager doe
This is the best pizza ever. I am originally from NYC and used to think it was Johns in the Village but I am changing my mind.
What a fun and hip spot outside the sportsbook at Aria.  We just had two slices-cheese with a white sauce and basil and meat.  Both were yummy.  I love the space and location and will be back!

So freaking yummy.  Try the Spendinis. So good we ordered another after finishing the first. We had the Margarita pizza and didn't disappoint! The cheese was perfect and so was the dough. Service was solid. Definitely recommend.

We just wanted to grab a quick bite there. Super nice place. The design is phenomenal like the entire Aria. Everything is about color and texture. Well the staff was very friendly and helpful. We chose six items from their Mozzarella bar. I was surprised about the quality of the food. Very exceptional. I saw them making pizza and what I saw convinced me. I will be back there to try more items for sure.

We were so excited to taste Five50 pizza. We heard some good things from friends. I'm not sure if it was an off day...which would be unlikely because the place was hardly busy. Well anyway, things started off good. We ordered the garlic knots and meatballs. Garlic knots were good and the meatballs were overwhelming (too many spices). We decided to go with 2 different pizzas (1 per couple Margherita and Gotham) 
1. Margherita had too much sauce and just oily. I mean it's pretty hard to mess up a Margherita pizza. 
2. The Gotham was tastier but sooooo oily. 
3. Elvis Milkshake was amazing according to my husband. 
3. Our waiter was just rude. Very cocky and not very attentive. Maybe his tight ass jeans and hipster glasses only made him seem  older than he already was or they were cutting off the circulation...Either way his attitude needed work. 

All in all not worth spending $28 for a pizza that was greasy and bleh. Secret Pizza Place in Cosmo next time. Although it doesn't seem like much of a secret anymore.
We had a blast here and had a party of 15! N we ordered a little of everything on the menu! Pizza AMAZING! Service AMAZING!!! Coming here is a must when in Vegas!!!!!!!

As far as pizza is concerned, the three pizzas had varied from good to lousy. The one major complaint was the crust was soggy. Not limp, but soggy wet as a dish towel, why is this so limp. 

The "Gotham" tasted good, the crust was soggy.

The "Forager" tasted good, The cust was not as soggy as the following nightmarish Pizza but far from crisp.

The "North Beach" just was horrid. Clams were in the shell and just baked on top of the pizza? What did we miss here? Why include clams if the pizza could not absorb the flavor of the seafood? The Crust was a MESS! The Clam liquid obviously bubbled onto the pizza and just soaked the pizza. This was a complete FAIL!

The wings were meh, ok in a chain restaurant type of place.

The server, Aaron (I think was the name) was excellent. He was professional, helpful and the true bright spot of the experience.

Pizza Type: Thin Crust
Business Type: Independent
Beer/Wine: Descent draft beer, bottles and wine selection

Overall opinion: As is tradition for me when trying a new pizza place for the first time, I had the Margherita pizza. It was delicious, and the freshness of the ingredients was apparent. My only issue is the value proposition, which cost it a 5th star.  They only offer one size (16"), which is too much for one person, but not enough for two, and they run around the $30 range. It was a great pizza, but should have been at least $10 less.  Because of the price of the pizza, I didn't get one of the delicious sounding milkshakes on the menu.  I would have ended up spending close to $50 for one person on a light meal.

Bonus:  Located at Aria Resort in Las Vegas, this is the only location and is headed by James Beard Award-winning Chef Shawn McClain.

Giving this one a 4.5 but rounding up to 5 because my biggest nit is with the desserts. 

First, stay basic here. Work from the Margarita base and add pepperoni. Or build your own with cheese, pepperoni, and basil. I'd go with half the amount of cheese, by the way.

The crust is outstanding but I do not like that the cheese oil soaks through it so quickly. That's why I recommend that you go with half the cheese. It still tastes great but it preserves the crust. The crust, by the way, is very good. 

The five50 chopped salad was OK. Nothing to write home about. 

The desserts were disappointing. The ice cream sandwiches had potential but the ice cream simply has too much air stirred into it. It's not premium ice cream. A few other desserts were simply not noteworthy. I'd really avoid the desserts. Make your way over to the Aria and grab dessert from Jean Philippe Patisserie. Cannot lose there. 

Still, the name of the game here is pizza. And Five50 does pizza well. Keep it simple and you'll be pleased with a five-star pizza.

Surprised the sports bar was replaced by pizza. I'm always up for a little wood fired thin crust pizza after a late night of gaming.  

The restaurant closes at midnight but the slice bar is open till 2am.  

Wanted to customize, watch out it adds up fast:
-sausage 
-meatball
-spinach 
-basil 
-eggplant 

Final tally was close to $40, slices are huge, really great crust and an abundance of ingredients in each bite.  Wait time: 20 minutes.  

If you're just wanting a light snack between two people, I would suggest ordering by the slice, a whole pie is WAY too much pizza, our tummies were not happy today.

$28 medium is too pricey for my pizza taste buds.

Don't get me wrong, it was still pretty good.

You get a few free (but tiny) breadsticks dipped in olive oil.

They do have a full bar and TVs everywhere.

Come here if you want to try something new, and only if you just won money at the tables or at the sportsbook next door.

Nothing makes me happier thatn pizza and a nice bottle of Italian wine. Five50 Pizza  has both. Really happy to have a casual dining pizza option in the Aria. General Manager Micah came over to our table to ensure everthing was going well. Super hospitable! We definitely will be back next time in Vegas!

Had half pepperoni and half forager with egg added.ordered it well done and were very happy when it came out extra crispy. The f orager was absolutely delicious with the added egg and would definitely order it again!

Ate here in August. We Always stay at Aria. Got the pepperoni & house sausage pizza. We were surprised the crust was chewy after being cooked in a wood-fired oven & the toppings were quite greasy. Really a let down for the place & price!!!
Best pizza I have had in a long time. The server was great. One pizza is big enough for two.

I loved this place! Parking garage @ Aria, easy access. servers were awesome dudes. My coworker and I got seated quickly. we started with garlic knots and wings. Im picky about wings and I lovvved them! Split the truffle pizza and gotham. So different but so good. This place is casual but doesnt taste cheap and i would definitely go back again and again! Great beer selection. I want to get dessert next time!

Hmm...not quite what what I was expecting.

We had a voucher for a free slice of pizza and a beer but the line for the pizza "bar" was long so we sat at a table. When we asked about the voucher, our waiter (in a rather irritable tone) said we could only redeem it at the bar. After walking off and coming back, he said he could deduct the price of the slice and beer from our bill at the end.

The garlic knots sounded good but instead of pretzel-like things or breadsticks like we thought, they were these little (and I empasize little) balls that were nothing but oil and grease. 

The pizza was just average. Typical New York variety where you have to fold it like a taco or eat it with a fork.

Even with the voucher, the bill was almost $60.

I absolutely loved this place! We got an Elvis shake which was to die for! A perfect blend of chocolate, peanut butter, banana, and just a dash of candied bacon. We got the Forager for pizza - it was really good - ricotta, mushrooms, spinach. I would go here again without hesitation. As far as price, it's a good deal for Vegas. We share the large pizza, which was $28, and also shared the shake which was $9.

So far, this is the best slice of convenience pizza I've had in Vegas. Walk up, pick out a slice (I went with white pizza, one of my favorites), pay, pick it up, and eat at the bar next door. They've got a decent selection of beers on tap, with a few craft varieties offered I'd never seen before. 

The slices are a good size and thin, just like NY pizza. Well, as close as you can get to it, anyway.

Walked in here instead because the Aria Race and Sports Book next door was full. Seahawks-Panthers game was playing. It's a non-smoking area still so it was all good. 

We enjoyed our Bloody Mary and Mimosas plus the TRUFFLE MAC N CHEESE while waiting for our airport pick up. This place was packed after 12 noon. Wow. 

If we weren't full or ran more miles that early morning,we could have tried their pizza because it's a pizza place! 

Helpful and friendly staff. Clean with decent chalk writings on the walls. Busy place for sure.

PASS THIS PLACE- The food and service here were awful. 

We came into this place with a reservation when we arrived in Vegas in September and right off the bat were not greeted at all. We should have known from there the experience would be bad. 

We sat down and were immediately rushed into ordering our food and drinks- after our drinks came, which were blah, our food  finally came. We ordered a traditional pepperoni pizza and a side of their so-called-famous meatballs. 
The pizza was SO GREASY that the oil was literally dripping off the side of the pizza while it was sitting on the stand. When we picked up a slice it would fall apart bc it was so greasy.

The meatball was just ok. Nothing to write home about. 

When our server came back to check on us we mentioned to her that the pizza was on the greasy side. She then said in a very rude tone that "That is how it is and that is normal for ALL pizza". I was offended with that remark. She has no idea what kind of pizza is normal if she thinks THAT was normal. 

Any who, the manger came over and had a very similar attitude. 

We paid our expensive tab and left- never to return, as I urge you to do the same.
Great pizza. Crust was amazing. Thin and cooked to perfection. Pepperoni and cheese was very tasty. Would come bAck again for sure.

The pizza was so delicious! Gourmet and sinful. Came on a Sunday night to meet friends for dinner and drinks. Our waiter was excellent, not fake or over the top, but super knowledgeable and efficient. It was busy, prime time, so we did wait a while for stuff to show up at the table, but we were there to relax and have good conversation, so nobody minded waiting. Plus, the pizza chefs are back there making everything from scratch, so you know, it takes time. My Bloody Mary was perfect. The Caesar salad was incredible. We ordered three pizzas and they were all to die for. We ordered two desserts, which were both splendid. Afterwards, the waiter was very kind about taking photos of our little group for us. What more could you want? 
Yeah, it's oily.
Sure, it's fattening.
It was a little bit of a wait at times for food to arrive. 
They're busy, because it's really good. Have a cocktail and enjoy being out!
(Also, they have tons of pizza by-the-slice business, so all in all, I think they were doing a great job of handling the rush.)
I would recommend this place to anyone coming to Vegas looking for epic pizza.

Not your average Pizza place...

I see a lot of people complaining and criticizing on here about the $5.50 cost of a slice of Pizza and it's size. This isn't Domino's folks or little Caesars. It's an upscale pizza place by a well known experienced higher tier chef and the food shows!

We dined at Five 50 over the weekend and thought it was awesome. We weren't sure what a pizza place would be like coming from a chef of Shawn McClain's caliber but we weren't disappointed in the least. It was even nice seeing him there expediting all the dishes and adding the finishing touches!

Our server John expertly guided us first through the drink menu and then through the food. We ordered everything he suggested and couldn't have been more pleased. The truffle pizza was to die for. Yes it was pricey, but you are paying for high end ingredients and it shows. The pork belly Carpaccio was equally as impressive.

If you want a down and dirty cheap slice of pizza that's as big as your head and mediocre in taste this isn't the place. If you  want to enjoy a good slice of pizza or other dishes, made with high end, fresh ingredients... I say go, and go again... and if you are dining in definitely ask to be seated in John's section.. he is super knowledgeable about food and will direct you to exactly what you are craving!

We will definitely be back again (and again and again)
Can never go wrong with pizza flatbread pepperoni pastrami gotta love it when you're drunk

Great place for pizza and a beer.  Good selection of local beers.  Megan is an awesome bartender who recommended a killer IPA that was light and refreshing.   She also recommended the Charcuterie and the wings.  Charcuterie was delish and the wings were full of flavor and just the right amount of heat.  Great balance.

Overall a great experience,  manager and chef came out and greater guests.

Good times, we'll be back!

When my husband wanted to grab pizza to bring over to our friend's place, I looked at him puzzled. I complained that there's so many other better choices than pizza. I mean c'mon it's pizza and this is Vegas!! But boy was I totally completely wrong because the pizza was so freakin delicious!!!!

We ordered 2 whole pizzas: Gotham and Forger and 2 salads: Caesar and Italian. We picked up our togo 50 mins later and headed off the strip to our friend's house, which was 25 mins away. 

Once we got there, we all dug in. To my complete surprise, the pizza was still crunchy and not the least bit soggy. The dough was so perfect and the flavors all meld together in harmony. It was so good that I ate a total of 3 1/2 slices (the slices are huge!). I really couldn't believe how good the pizzas were! 

Now I can't wait to go back to Vegas to grab some pizza. I wouldn't recommend the salads though. It was small and boring. Skip it.


Remember, the next time your SO suggest to get pizza, don't be an ass because you might end up eating your own words like I did.

*** PROS ***
* Quick "to go" line for slices of pizza
* Amazing, delicious pizza! We had the Gotham w/pepperoni and other meats, and a slice with white sauce, spinach, mushrooms --- both were heavenly!!
*** CONS ***
* None.
Go now, eat, and enjoy!

We got a full pizza from here which was priced at 35 dollars which is something you can expect from a pizza joint on the strip. The pizza was decent at best. It barely had any sauce on it. The best part of the pizza was the crust because it was thin and crispy. I dont think ill visit this place again.

We decided to use our My Vegas rewards to cash in for the slice of pizza and a pint of beer at Five 50.  It's 10000 points which seemed like a decent price for lunch.  We arrived at 11am and went to the hostess stand for the restaurant and told her we were there for the My Vegas deal.  She said the restaurant was not open and to go to the walk up place.  We did.  The person there acted confused and started to say they weren't open, but of course, there were pizzas sitting there, so that made no sense.  She told us that the place where they get the beer is under construction so she had to go get the beers from the bar in the restaurant (like 20 feet away).  We're like, "OK".  Then she says you can have Bud LIght or 3-2-1.  So what we weren't sure about because she was not very clear and it was really loud in there from the overhead music was if we could only have Bud LIght or 3-2-1 because the regular beer thing was closed or if that is all you get on this deal.  Either way that sucked.  If you're using an offer like this to advertise your business, giving me shitty beer is a sure way to not impress me enough to come back.

Next, to the pizza.  There were four options.  I chose the mushroom and spinach with a white sauce and the husband had the many meats selection.  They stick the pieces into the over to heat them for a couple of minutes.  Then since we were told the restaurant was closed, we took our food to the sports book to eat at a table there.  The pizza was fine.  It's that thin crust type which is not my favorite.  The ingredients seemed good, but between the crap beer and the ok pizza and weird service, I have no desire to return.  Then we were checking out the restaurant hours and it said they opened at 11am... sooooo,  Okay then.  Whatever.

Flakey and meh food and drink in one of my least favorite casinos.  Probably will not be back. Can't recommend.

So I've been meaning to write a review about this place, bc I came here with a group of 11 and they were SO accommodating!

We got to sit at their special table reserved for larger parties, which was super luxe and somewhat sectioned off, which I like.  The only problem with this table is the fact that there really isn't much room between the chairs and the "wall," so it seemed like the servers were having a hard time getting around us.  Not a big deal since we made do, but a bit of a design snafu.

They have a great selection of cocktails, wines, and beers, although it's vegas and I was pretty hungover so I had iced tea instead (this was ok, but had an over-steeped, bitter aftertaste).

Since a portion of our party got there first, we decided to order a couple of salads: we had one with arugula and one with burrata.  Of the two, no contest: the burrata was the clear winner, the perfect riff on your classic Caprese.

Being that our group was so large, we just decided to order one of each of their specialty pizzas.  In addition to your standard fare like Margherita pizza and Sicilian, they also had a few more unique ones - one with clams, one with truffles, and another with egg!  The pizzas are actually a lot bigger than I thought they would be; they're 16 inches in diameter.  I didn't get to try all of them, but the two I did have were SO delicious: the Forager (with mushrooms) and the Farmstead (the one with egg - mind you, I'm a huge sucker for runny eggs).

TIP: Not sure if it's standard that they bring hot chili oil with the food, but if you don't get it, ask for it.  That stuff is amazing.

Because we ordered so many pizzas, they notified us that it would take a bit for them to come out.. That being said, they brought out a few of their appetizers to tide us over.  The toasted marcona almonds were good (although not as crunchy as I would like), the olives were really unctious and delicious (but if I could eat one thing for the rest of my life it would probably be olives, so I'm slightly biased), the veggies were pretty standard (good but unremarkable), and the chicharrones are the best darn chicharrones I've ever had (haven't had a wide variety, but these were perfectly seasoned and fried).

The service was great, although there were a few kinks here and there.  Drinks took a while to refill and such, but it was their second day of operation and the rest of the friendly service more than made up for it.

this is the 1st and only time I will ever say this -- the salad was the star of the meal. the arugula and fennel. with cheese. oh, so delicious. I ate nearly the entire plate, except for the bites that my husband had to literally had to distract me for so that I wouldn't notice his taking away the best parts of my life.

the sandwiches were OK. the pizza was good, but I mean -- $30 for a whole pizza? for 2? (not 2. don't believe the menu. unless it's a very hungover or very drunk 2.)

Real wood burning, brick oven pizza. The right amount of sauce and cheese! We had a basic pepperoni pizza for $26 bucks all 4 of us had a quick bite before watching Zarkana! Service was A+. Pizza was so good we picked up another pizza to go after the show!!!
AAAmazing Pizza!! You can truly taste the quality ingredients.  Everything so yummy and fresh.  THE BEST Pizza in Las Vegas PERIOD.

Really great pizza and wonderful service! We were in Vegas from Sacramento. One of our party had eaten there before and claimed it was her "favorite" pizza so I was edited to try it! It was really great!! It will be on the list for every Vegas trip from now on!

Maybe not the best pizza I've had, but it's definitely yummy, especially if you're very hungry.  If you're getting a single slice beware that it's not that large--definitely order two. I was hungry again within hours of finishing mine. Both times I used the MYVEGAS reward to get a free slice and beer.  This second time around I passed on the beer since they no longer had cider as an option and the only choice was miller lite and some other regular beer (ew).  But for only 7000 points I cant complain.  I ordered the forager and it was delicious.

Our original plan had been to go to the Aria buffet and then off to our show but after an hour in line we realized it wasn't going to happen and had to come up with an alternative plan fast. It turned out to be the Five50. Best alternate plan ever.

I always judge a restaurant by customer service first then the food. The customer service was spot on the evening we were there. We had no wait, our order was taken quickly, drinks arrived in a timely manner, as did the food. The server, Sam, was very  friendly and courteous.

We had a basic pizza with onions and bacon. It came with full on slices of bacon and chunks of onion. No cutting back which made the price more than worth it.  It was hot, cheesy, and messy just like you'd expect a great pizza to be.

I'm not sure how to judge the cost. Yes it was expensive but it's Vegas and it's the Aria. What do you expect? As long as the customer service and food are above par then I'm fine with cost.

I can definitely recommend Five50 and we will be back.

Began with the cesar salad which was good. Great presentation, dressing wasn't overpowering. Then came the pizza, margarita, if a place can't get a regular cheese pizza right then why order anything else. Well they couldn't get it right. Still very doughy under the cheese (raw dough). Cheese at best was just standard, nothing special. If you're in the mood for
Pizza, I've had great pizza at the Sugar Factory and the Cosmo. Skip this place. Expensive. Then we had the chocolate brownie mouse thingy,  it was good but they tried to get too fancy with the mason jar so it tips over, it's not a bad dessert but it's interesting flavors with the whipped cream and basil. First and only time I'll go here. I couldn't bring myself to giving this place 3 stars.

First off: this review does not reflect the deliciousness of the pizza here. I'm writing this review because I had high expectations and perhaps should have lowered them. Our waitress literally behaved like she had everything in the world better to do than to help us out. When she took our order she was rude and impatient. I'm sincerely hoping she was having a bad day, (still gave her 20% of course). She did not check on us once, (mind you this was around 2 pm, not a lot of people). I really wanted pizza from seeing other yelp reviews so I asked her about the Forager pizza and she said "oh don't get that, you can't have it to yourself it's way too big." Okay, fine, no slices. So I ordered a small salad and stood in the "slice to go" line and brought it back to my table. By the way, the lady working the slice counter could not have been sweeter! I'm left with a sour taste from the lack of menu variety as well as the icy treatment from our waitress. We will definitely find another pizza spot next time.
This place is amazing! I ended up going here twice during a 3 day trip. It was definitely best white pizza I've ever had. Also tried the margherita pizza, which was really good as well.

Went for dinner while staying at Aria. It was good pizza. I wouldn't crave it but it was tasty. We had the Blanca and Some calamari. 
The space was comfy and easy to go in and sit.

Stopped by here because the original restaurant we wanted to eat were over booked and seeing that we needed some food before hitting the club we ran across Five50. We also noticed that we didn't have time to dine in and opted to order slices togo while watching the raiders game. 

The slices of these pizza, a nice greasy thin large slices was full of flavor and the prices were pretty good for what you get. they have a little round tables if you want to eat your slices right there and the crushed peppers and cheese is right next to the register.

Avoid getting beer and water like everywhere in vegas regular water is $5.00 and corona is $8 yikes, but not the fault of the business itself.

Gotham pizza.. Wings... Caesar salad

Believe it or not I HATE PIZZA BUT SHAWN MC CLAIN... wow. Blew my mind with how good E V E R Y T H I N G is here. Literally everything.

Had to update cause I forgot the most AMAZING part.. the service. One of the managers was very attentive and helpful. Believe his name was Johnathan .. keep it up!

Decent pizza located inside the Aria. I'm not the biggest fan of pizza so it's hard for me to be greatly impressed by it. Our group of six got a farmstead pizza, a forager pizza, and an order of chicken wings. Wings were decent, although not very memorable. The forager had white sauce, mushrooms, bacon, whipped ricotta, and spinach. The farmstead consisted of proscuitto, creme fraiche, farm egg, and country olives. Both pizzas were pretty good and offered some unique, interesting flavor combinations. They were generous with the toppings although there was quite of bit of grease on them. Some of the slices had quite the soggy crust. At close to $30 per pizza, it's definitely not on the cheap side either. I'll probably try to find someplace else to eat next time I'm in the Aria.

We wanted to grab a quick lunch before heading out to Valley of Fire, and happened upon this restaurant at Aria. I'm not a fan of pizza, so a gourmet pizza place wouldn't seem to be the best option for me. Fortunately the offered things other than pizza. I ordered the meatball Parmesan sandwich and my wife ordered a salad with grilled chicken. 

The meatballs had a nice taste to them, the bread was perfectly toasted and the cheese nicely melted. The sauce was a little on the sweet side, almost like a pizza sauce, but that didn't detract from the overall taste too much. The chicken on my wife's salad was perfectly cooked and the salad greens were fresh and crisp.

The waiter was very friendly and helped with menu selections. If the pizza is anywhere near as good as what we had, it is worth the trip for pizza as well.
Fantastic pizza and antipasto dishes. We ordered the meatballs and the arancini. Both were delicious. Reasonably priced (for Vegas) and high quality. A great casual dining option.

The server Amanda was what was lacking here.  The food was a little pricey and tasted fine but the server,  she was rude and slow and made our entire table feel unwelcome. 
 We came on a Tuesday night when they were not particularly busy.  It seemed there was only one server for about 8 or more tables. We waited awhile until Amanda came to our table.  She seemed highly annoyed and was really short with us.  We felt like we were bothering her.  Two pizzas and two appetizers took 30 mins to appear and someone in a suit brought it to the table.  There was a nice bus boy that refilled our water and was doing all the busy work for Amanda.  I work in the foods industry as did everyone at my table.  We could tell Amanda had a lot of tables but we watched her make this poor bus boy do all the heavy lifting while she just kind of drifted around the dining room.   When one of my group asked her for a to go box, we got  more attitude.  Amanda was annoying,  inattentive and lazy. When I come back I hope she's not there.  The service really overshadowed the food this time.
Coming from the poker room, this pizza is great. High quality ingredients, good crust. It helps a lot if you get if hot out of the oven. We sat and ate once, and the service was good.

Okay so really the pizza here isn't bad..but it is expensive.  So why not pay a few dollars more and get the truffle since all the pizzas are around the same price.  So I did like that there was a good truffle flavor (I think they toss some truffle oil to enhance the flavor), however there is wayyy too much cheese.  I felt so gross eating, and definitely exceeded by fat content for the week.  If you do decide to try this, I recommend just getting a slice, rather than an entire pizza like we did.

Went here with a group of friends and I was not disappointed.  We had a reservation (highly recommended) and were seated right on time.  The staff was friendly and courteous and our waiter was very knowledgeable.

Walking in, the restaurant has all the feel of a modern and upscale restaurant, but doesn't feel pretentious or stuffy (we dressed smart-casusal).  They actually have a to-go slice line near the entrance in case you need your late night fix or don't have time to sit down to eat.  The decor is very nice and the restaurant has a warm and inviting feeling thanks to the wood features and Edison lights.   

We ordered drinks and the porchetta (grilled pork belly) and arugula & fennel salad.  the porchetta was absolutely delicious with a nice mix of salty/savory from the pork belly and tart/sweet from the apple.  The arugula & fennel salad was very tasty, tangy and fresh which provided a nice contrast to the porchetta.

For main courses we ordered three different pizzas, a Truffle, a Gotham and a Blanca.  I ordered the truffle and it was absolutely amazing.  I tried the Gotham and it was also very delicious.  I did not try the Blanca but my friends said that it was very delicious.

All things considered, the prices are very fair and it was well worth the experience.  I would recommend this place and we will go back next time we are in Vegas.

Stayed at Aria and decided to have dinner at this place since I've seen plenty great reviews on Yelp.  Needless to say, our Yelpers are right on the money.  This place, not only has great service and attentive servers, they also have really great pizza!  Ordered the GOTHAM.  Didn't disappoint.  Had cravings for it the next day. Yummy.

Really average pizza in a fancy setup. The crust was not crisp enough, instead we had a limp crust which was weighed down by too much cheese. The spicy pizza had hatch chili peppers on it...And the garlic bread was so oily, it seemed to be fried instead of baked. The tomato sauce was great though.

This was our first dinner in Vegas. We had gotten in late due to a delayed flight and were starving. We walked in and got seated immediately. Then we were impressed with a beer menu, there were some we recognized and some we don't get out here. So, we experimented with a couple unusual choices and then stared at the menu.

The menu is small-ish but appears well chosen. We had the blanca pizza and were finely rewarded. It was one of the best white pizzas I have ever had, the crust was thin and crispy, the sauce was very tasty and the toppings were perfect. 

There is also a slice bar which is open longer than the full-service restaurant. So if you need a late night bite, it might be your baby.

My review is based on my experience with the management, not the food. The food is just ok, nothing to write home about. Secret pizza at Cosmo is better.

The manager on duty failed to do his duties when I requested him to call security to come assist me when I was being harassed by a drunk belligerent man while in line. I felt unsafe and wanted security to come but the manager NEVER CALLED them. He in fact lied to me saying that they were too busy to assist me. I spoke to security later on that night and they told me they never received a call. 

SHAME ON YOU manager on duty Sunday 1:30AM for lying about calling security.
Damn good pizza! Italia has got some competition here because the slices are hearty and the flavor is good. Forager is the BOMB.COM.
Had the bucatini & meatballs. The bucatini & sauce were delicious but did not like the meatballs. They had raisins mixed in. I had the large portion & for the price it was way overpriced.

We wanted to find a hang out spot to kill sometime and since we were stating at Aria, we decided to just stop by at one of their spots.  Walked in at around 330pm and was able to find a spot at the bar. Ordered some drinks and appetizers just to kill time and hang out. 

- Old Fashion - this is one of the best that I've had since the one I've tried in TN. They squeeze fresh orange to give it a fresh taste and it's absolutely perfect.

- Bloody Mary - they use fresh ingredients and a homemade tomato juice that's absolutely amazing. 

- Beef Carpaccio - this was just ok, it came with arugula, sliced beets and peanuts.

- Chef's 3 - we chose burrata, mortadello, and cappicola. It was an amazing mix of meat and cheese. It was served with their homemade mustard, pickled veggies and olives. 

I would definitely come back here for their old fashion, it was my absolute favorite. Staff are very friendly and tentative. Great food, great drinks and great service!

having this place in our hotel was awesome. we sat at the bar and had some delicious pizza by the slice for affordable prices (by vegas tourist prices anyways).

we tried the margarita, blanca, meat, and forager. all were delicious. honestly the plain margarita was my least favorite bc the other with toppings were sooooo good and baked to crispy perfection!
My dog eats better food than this crap. Glad I spent a ton on this awful lunch. Do yourself a favor and go anywhere else.

Fantastic pizza!  Perfect crust. Just chewy enough and the toppings are delicious. My better half got the meat pizza and we shared the Gotham and spinach and mushroom - forager and Blanca. All were great. The ricotta was the best. Best meal since we've been here. Also very reasonably priced.

After a long day, and running around, my go to meal is always Pizza. For a quick slice I made my way over.  I only wanted a piece to go. They had four pizzas to choose from. They each looked great.  I went with the meat lovers pizza, see the picture.  The pizzas appear to be from a fire oven. I feel that adds a little extra taste, as long as it is not burned.  Also, they were not just out of the oven, so they had time to set. This was truly a great pizza. 9.5/10
While I ordered the pizza to go, they have a few standing tables to eat your slice.  Also, just around the corner is a cafe you can sit down to eat. 

Ciao

Stopped here for a quick bite before going to dinner. Had a delicious slice of pizza with goat cheese, onions, eggplant and heirloom tomatoes. Pleasant service also and the place was packed with patrons.

This place near the casino makes fantastic pizza! We wanted to get some good food without spending a lot and get out quickly so we decided to try this place. We were seated at the table in about 10 minutes and ordered a margarita pizza. The pizza came out quickly and the crust was amazing. Perfectly done, with the right amount of crunchiness. I have had some neopolitan pizzas that are too soggy, but this was awesome, eat with your hands style pizza, no fork needed. Very good taste - nothing crazy, just good pizza at a decent price. If you sit down be prepared to sit closely next to other people, the tables are set pretty tight together. Aria has good food choices and this place does not disappoint!

Came here after the LV Rock n Roll Half when I was literally ready to eat anything in my path. Originally, I had thought about Secret Pizza at the Cosmopolitan, but with the prospect of a potential long wait and no designated seating area, it didn't seem like a good idea. 

My friend D suggested Five50 as she'd been here before. 

Unfortunately, this became another case of bad service. When we arrived, we were told it would be a 15-20 minute wait--no problem. But when we were called, our table wasn't actually ready, the bus boys were nowhere to be found, and our hostess was frantically trying to clean the table. 

We sat down, and a few minutes later, a large party was seated next to us. We still hadn't been greeted. The large party had their order taken first. I was ready to cry... I was famished and I wondered what it would take to get some pizza. 

Finally our order was taken,  but everything took forever... Getting drinks, etc.  we needed a second pizza (I was starving!!!!) and it took a whole again to flag someone down to order more food. 

The pizza was quite good. We had the Margharita pizza and it hada nice light crispy crust , the right amount of lovely tomato sauce, and great mozzarella and fresh basil. 

Who knows? Off night? The pizza is good, but the service was not on point when we were there.
This place only gets two stars because of the really good beer selection. The pizza was the greasiest I have ever had and my partner's sandwich was pretty meh.

Ate here on Thanksgiving, after giving up on trying to find a buffet without a 2 hour wait. 

We each got a beer, split a salad and ordered an entire pizza. Our bill was under $50 and the food was really good! We even went back to the hotel with extra pizza, which we ate for lunch the next day. 

I would highly recommend this tucked away gem for a "cheap" and delicious Vegas meal!
PIZZA! Good  variety  of beers -great  wings  - whole  pies to eat in or  slices to go. Servers are fun. Go down the hall for  gelato  afterwards..

I came here for an impromptu lunch while staying at the Aria hotel. There were four of us and we each got the lunch special, which is a great deal! For $18 we got a prosciutto melon salad and a personal pan pizza. You could either order one of their signature pizzas or create your own with three toppings, so we all got different ones and split them. The salad was delicious - it had the perfect flavor. The pizzas were all unique and you could tell that they had come straight from the oven! We got the meat lovers, the truffle and the spicy pizzas and they were all wonderful. I can't pick a favorite! We also started with a sin city pale ale and a shot of NV whiskey. I would definitely come back here!

Came in looking to try out Aria's new casual pizza place. The concept had a lot of promise - a grab and go pizza joint located right next to the poker room, race & sports book, and casino. I redeemed MyVegas rewards to get what was billed as a slice and a beer for about 10,000 points. To redeem points,  you have to go to the mLife desk in the casino. The clerk gave me a $17 voucher good for whatever I wanted at Five50, which made me realize that a slice of pizza and a beer cost 17 dollars?!?!? 

I ended up redeeming for two slices of pizza and a bottle of diet coke for $15. I got the Gotham and the Margherita - both were good, but nothing I'd clamor to return for. They set up some round tables off to the side near the entrance to the Sports Book for people who just want to grab a quick slice. Frankly, I still prefer the pizza over at the Cosmopolitan's secret pizza place more, but Five50 is a decent option within Aria.

Heirloom Tomato Salad.
Shrimp Crostini.
Gotham Pizza.

Pretty good.
:)

For those of you who have been to aria, you know it's a rather upscale ritzy place. Not really the type of place you'd imagine a pizza by the slice bar, right? Enter Five50....a sit down Italian restaurant serving artisan specialty pizza as well as the typical overpriced dishes and a huge selection of craft beer. Sit down with a group and expect your tab to be in the high hundreds. 

Then, aria decided to try to be like the cosmo (in my opinion) and added the "to go" line that sells slices of pizza. (no, you cannot get a single slice when you sit down inside) there are 3 or 4 types to choose from... Cheese, a meat slice, a veggie slice, and a rotating seasonal slice. I've had all of them. I find the pizza here to be very artisinal, If that makes sense. The crust is more of the wood fire baked pizza or stone fired pizza etc. It's chewy and yeasty and quite good, especially if you're into that type of thing.

All slices are just under $6 with tax and all of them are good. The tomato sauce is A1...i was thinking in my head that the pizza was a 3/5 but then the sauce really just pushes it to a 4..its probably the best pizza sauce ive had. Not overly sweet, with a nice zest to it and it complements the crust perfectly. 

The overall atmosphere here is kind of weird.. Like I can't walk up and get a slice and feel normal walking through the casino with this pizza. It's right next to the sports bar and right across from the high limit slots...strange. However, I think aria did a nice job of trying to combine their atmosphere with a place for guests to get drunk quick food without leaving their property. It's not my #1 choice, but it's 2nd and it's still solid.

We had the north beach style pizza and it was really good. Piña colada shake was good too but not the orange shake. Service is ok, not too friendly servers or receptionist.   Food are on the pricey side. Our pizza took so long so the manager brought it to our table and served our first slice. Because of that, instead of 2, I'm giving this place 3 stars.
Five50 is one of my favorite pizza places in the country.  You can't go wrong with the Gotham!

Greattttt pizza!  You can get slices, but do know you have to get more than 2 if you'd like to get a box to go.  Otherwise, you can step across the way and eat standing up.  

I heard that the restaurant itself was a bit slow and as I didn't have much time, the slices were perfect.  Unfortunately they sell the tiny coke bottles that hold a sip's worth of soda--you're going to need more than a sip as the pizza is a bit salty.

Bon Appetit!

If you are a pizza place and you fuck up pizza then something is clearly wrong with you. Five50 thankfully does not..however I did go for Happy Hour and ordered pizza by the slice.

I highly recommend (if they are still doing it) to show up between 5-5:50PM during their happy hour, get faded and eat pizza. The ultimate sloth life daily regiment.

I had pizza from here my first night in Vegas around 2am.  The pizza was excellent but after that many drinks anything tastes good at 2am.  I decided to try it another time when I wasn't intoxicated and it was even better.  It was so good that I am ready to call it the best pizza I ever had.  I've been to Gramaldi's in Brooklyn, Lombardi's in Manhattan, Motorino in Brooklyn, Di Fara's in Brooklyn, John's on Bleeker Street, and Frank Pepe's....but Five50 is #1.  By the way, Frank Pepe is 2nd.

Craving pizza in Vegas is a tough position to be in because there seem to be a bunch of low end, quick options but not quality picks. We were really satisfied by the unique combinations available here and the high quality of the ingredients that they used on the pizzas. The server was very attentive and friendly and there was actually a small selection of craft beer of tap (a rarity in Vegas, where cheap beer and yards of icy drinks are the norm). Sadly, we discovered this at ghe
Solid pizza considering this is Las Vegas. For a Chicago chef I expected more, but definitely a better alternative to Grimaldis.

I had their white pizza with spinach and it was out of this world good. We were at the sportbook in Aria and it was just next to the entrance of it. I was almost tempted to get a second slice but didn't cause of dinner plans lol. Worth the $5.50 because it's really 2 slices.

Great choice after a long night of drinking and dancing, the joint for a late night craving!!! Crust is a perfect thin pizza, not to thin just perfect. Cheese is fresh and silky, sauce is just right, Gotham was great but the Margherita just was right for a night of drinks.

Grouchy waitress here, slow service at the bar. Tough times in Vegas. I think the bartender heard me complaining and tried to make it up afterwards. End of the day... Food is good. So if you don't care about customer service, come and grab a pizza.

Pure pizza heaven!  I love my pizza and this place makes some great pizza. My fav was double sauce with olive. I ate the whole thing myself. Brick oven crust is fantastic - chewy, crispy and extremely tasty.

We were in vegas for 4th of July and we had the chance to try Five 50...  I was really amazed at the food.  We had the truffle and Gotham pizzas and they tasted Great.  They also have high end beer on draft.  The atmosphere is really nice and cozy.  so the food was excellent but the service was even better.  We had a nice guy named Sam wait on us and he kept checking back on us when the food was taking too long.  Over all, this was a great place to dine at.  Highly recommended.

$10.81 for ONE greasy greasy slice of cheese and a sprite...you be the judge...is it worth it for what one slice costs when you can get a whole pie for that price and its quality is pretty similar to delivery.

The BEST Pizza in Vegas.

Apparently just declaring best in show isn't enough..
Is it the unique quality of toppings and tastes??
Is it the fact the pizza is cooked in a wood-burning oven??
Or that for a few dollars and two minutes time, you can eat amazing pizza without any hassle. 

There is a full bar and restaurant seating in case you want to wine and dine but no matter any of the additional critiques that might go into these reviews, the pizza is so GOOD that even if the waiter dropped a plate or forgot my Coke and called me silly, I'd still award 5stars cause it tastes that much better than any other pizza I can think of within any reasonable distance.

Grabbed a quick slice between meetings and gambling. A good cure for a mid day hangover.  The pizza is decent. Not as good as a Chicago deep dish. But this is Las Vegas. And I don't expect the best. Was a good value also.....

Very good pizza. Shady cashier. Gave me a slice with a completely burnt crust. I asked her if there was anyway I could wait for a fresh pizza to be made. She said it would take long as they would have to run out of all the remaining slices. I was like whatever took my slice went to wash my hands and 30 seconds later came back to see a brand new pizza replacing the initial one with burnt slices. When I asked her if I could swap slices, she started giving me attitude, and coming up with all kinds of excuses. 
Not the business
My good friends family brought me and my husband here once. Very nice area, expensive pizza but never hurt to try! Blanca is not bad. Good place for family or group of friends.

This place is probably 3.5 stars, but as Yelp doesn't allow that I rounded down to 3.

I had a slice of their mushroom pizza - which costs $5.50 hence the name of the place.  It was decent, slightly salty and plenty of mushrooms.  The crust was a bit chewy and thicker than I like.

The price was reasonable for the quality of food, but really if you want the best slice in Vegas then you have to find the "secret" pizza place in Cosmopolitan and have a slice of the white pizza - amazing!

REAL RATING: 2.5 stars

I love Vegas. I also believe everyone else does too. You'll often meet people who say they're over it or hate it, however, I believe they're obsessed with it deep down inside. Vegas brings back a lot of great memories - birthdays, bachelor parties, weekend getaways with past girlfriends, taking a roadtrip out there with some of my closest friends, etc. It's one of the few standing places in the world where you can go and do, literally, whatever you want, whenever you want. I've grown to appreciate Vegas more and more with age. 

However, one thing I don't like about Vegas is how much the restaurants located on The Strip rip you off - average food at a below average quality. Everybody, I introduce you to Five50 Pizza Bar. 

This was my last meal in Vegas during my most recent trip. I was out there for CES (Consumer Electronics Show). A few of my buddies and I decided to have dinner here before my 8pm flight because we were all extremely hungover. Something carby, cheesy and greasy sounded good - PIZZA! Located on the casino floor of the beautiful Aria Hotel and Casino, I thought this place would really impress. However, like many of my Strip dining experiences, I was incredibly underwhelmed. 

SHAVED PORK BELLY "PORCHETTA" ~ 4 stars ~ $15: Shaved apples, apple butter and celery sitting on top of a thin bed of shaved pork belly. To be honest, the first bite didn't impress me. In fact, I thought it was very bad. However, my friend convinced me to try another bite, which I did. It actually turned out to get better as I was eating it. The reason is because my first bite was dominated by apple flavors with hints of saltiness from the pork. But after another bite, my taste buds settled down the apple taste and the pork belly took over. I recommend this dish as a starter. 

FARMSTEAD PIZZA ~ 2 stars ~ $25: Proscuitto, creme fraiche, farm eggs and country olives. Look, if you're going to charge 25 bucks for, essentially, a medium sized pizza with only six slices, it better be awesome. Where Five50 falls flat on their face is their crust. They claim they're a spin on East Coast style pizza, but it's so far from that. The crust was flimsy and doughy. Another thing that sucked? It was WAY to salty. Proscuitto, olives and cheese? Yeah, it was a sodium bomb! The eggs were runny but damn was it salty! I must have downed three glasses of water with each slice. I had to eat it though. My body was in dire need of food. 

The worst part about Five50 was the service. This is a little surprising considering they market themselves as an upscale pizza joint in the middle of a high-end casino and resort. Our server would literally drop our plates and flatware on the table, not gently place them in front of us. He was spilling everywhere when pouring our water. What pissed me off the most is that he didn't even apologize for anything. He wasn't cool. In fact, he was a total douche. I hope he chokes on something (it's Monday, I'm kind of in a foul mood. You gotta excuse me.).

I did not expect much from looking at the pizza bar, but getting a fresh pie was a different story. The pizza was delicious. I got the Farmstead for my half and my friend got the blanca with peppers. Luckily, my meal was paid for, otherwise it would have been a $100 tab for the one pizza, an appetizer and several drinks. Not worth that kind if price but if you limit the $8 beers you'll be okay. I recommend getting whole pizza made for you and not settling for pizza that sits and waits at the pizza bar.
We had a great dinner here the other night. We tried the mozzarella sampler and the forager pizza. Both were great, as was the service.
Very good pizza, bought it by the slice and unless your starving 1 slice is enough. Would have given 5stars if the girl at the register would have smiled

Dominique the bartender & I go way back to when Julian Serrano opened so I am bias on her.. but really she is fantastic.  Now, I always get the 3 meat & cheese board w/ a glass of wine.  Previous times when they first opened & I was in a rush for food before heading to the sportsbook, I grabbed a slice of pizza (forget the long lines), meatballs (had raisins or something in em.. yuck), the duck confit crostini (yum, no longer on the menu, lol) honestly I could not be happy here.  

One day, I noticed a chalkboard, 'HUMBOLT Fog goat cheese' that spoke my language, I asked the bartender what I could get w/ that & he said I could pick 3 or 6 different meats & cheeses, like a charcuterie board.  Great!  

Now, I'm totally happy w/ Five50.  If it wasn't for this, I'd give only 3 stars.  The wonderfully seasoned chewy bread, pitted olives, pear or apple, mustard, love the spicy Chorizo, usually have Dominique pick another meat side to try w/ the goat cheese.  Paired w/ the wine it is fantastic, quick & I'm on my way in about 5.50 lol.  Cheers!

I ate here with 3 friends around 5pm on a Saturday. One of my friends had a sore throat and was looking for a specific whiskey to help her throat. The restaurant did not carry the whiskey so our waitress went to ask her manager if my friend would be able to go get her drink from the casino and bring it in. Next thing we knew the waitress came back with the whiskey. She went outside the restaurant and tracked it down and only charged her $10 for it. Fabulous service for such a casual place. The pizza was delicious as well. Very rich and filling so I would definitely recommend sharing or just ordering a slice. I had the farmstead pizza and it was amazing. All very delicious and fresh ingredients. I will definitely be coming back for more.

Spot has a cool vibe. I'd like to come back and just have some beers and watch a game. I enjoyed the pizza and chicken salad. Would write a better review and take more pics, but we were too busy enjoying the food!

I came to Five50 pizza bar on Sunday to try their Restaurant Week lunch menu. I am super pleased with my experience. For $20.13 I received an amuse bouche of super addictive cheesy, garlic bread, a cup of white bean soup, 2 margherita pizza slices and a vanilla ice cream sandwich with a shot of blood orange soda.

Everything was super delicious; the soup was nice and hearty (although I could've done without the dried herbs) and the pizza was super delicious. For dessert I expected a run-of-the-mill ice cream sandwich, what I got was a sandwich comprised of two galletes with vanilla ice cream, how cool is that? The blood orange soda is made in house and was amazing as well. 

The service was great as well; our waitress told us a ittle about the chf and asked us where else we were going to go for RW. She recommended Sage, which I tried at RW when it opened and is mind-blowing. 

In short, you must try their Restaurant Week menu, I dare say it's the best deal yet!
Totally decent NY style pizza. I think Secret Pizza at Cosmo has a better white pie, but the service and kicking beats are definitely better here.
The water is triple filtered yuuuuuuck and the sand was great, the dressing was perfect.  The pizza was good (not the best I ever had, but yummy) they use black and green olives)

Very poor quality for the price. The slice counter is under staffed and the wait time is long just to get a simple pizza slice.
